page.title: 19THE HITCHING STONE
page.content: This stone is one of the largest free-standing stones in this part of Yorkshire.It is a mystery as to how it came to be in its present position,as it would appear to be out of place when looking at the surrounding countryside,which is mainly moorland. {"All alone stands the Hitching Stone, {On the moor so poor,stands a mystery {That will never be unravelled. {On a spooky night,when the moon shone {Bright,from Pendle Hill would fly {The witches with laughter in their {Eyes.Everyone on Hallowe'en would stay {Away from the witches mean. {How did it get there?Did a giant throw {It through the air?Did the ice-age men {Who made valleys green put it there {For it to be seen?Has it been there {From the beginning of the earth,or did {Someone somewhere give it its birth?" Christy Hodgson aged 10 years
